alert.note: Alert for Clay; Kanawha; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Roane; Southeast Nicholas (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 11:13AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Nicholas, eastern Kanawha, southeastern Roane, Clay and northern Fayette Counties through 1145 AM EDT... At 1113 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pratt, or 17 miles southwest of Clay, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Summersville, Fayetteville, Clay, Montgomery, Ansted, Clendenin, Cedar Grove, East Bank, Glasgow, Smithers, Gauley Bridge, Pratt, Pinch, Powellton, Glen, Hawks Nest State Park, Elkview, Burnwell, Big Otter and Wallback. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 9 and 10, and between mile markers 32 and 42. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 65 and 76. Route 19 between mile markers 18 and 55. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
